subject: Negotiation
title: Dining Etiquette as Negotiation
description: A quick, practical guide to Dining Etiquette as Negotiation.

hook.text: In South Korea, refusing a drink from a senior executive is like refusing their friendship.

buildup.text: Business meals are where real relationships are built â€” and where cultural mistakes are most visible.

discovery.text: In France, discussing business during the meal itself is considered vulgar. Save it for after dessert.

twist.text: How you eat, drink, and tip reveals more about your cultural intelligence than any presentation.

climax.text: Learn dining customs before every international trip. The dinner table is a negotiation table in disguise.

punchline.text: A meal is never just a meal. It's a trust-building session.

quiz.question: Why are business meals culturally important?
options: They're where relationships are built and cultural competence is judged
